@@ -225,6 +270,11 @@ def __init__(self, negative_slope=1e-2, inplace=False):
     def forward(self, input):
         return self._backend.LeakyReLU(self.negative_slope, self.inplace)(input)
 
+    def __repr__(self):
+        inplace_str = ', inplace' if self.inplace else ''
+        return self.__class__.__name__ + ' (' \
+            + 'negative slope = ' + str(self.negative_slope) \
body: If you're printing a number, I'd limit it to a specified number of decimal places. If someone initializes this with `math.sqrt(1/10)` they'll get quite a long output.
